¡Eso es fantástico! It's great to hear that you're enjoying salsa and bachata music, and that it's helping you with your dancing. Music plays a huge role in salsa and bachata, and being able to connect with the rhythm and energy of the music can make all the difference in your dancing.

As you continue to improve your footwork and turns, I recommend paying attention to the different rhythms and instruments in the music. Salsa and bachata music often feature a strong emphasis on percussion, which can help you stay on beat and improve your timing. Listen to the congas, timbales, and bongos, and try to let their rhythms guide your movements.

Additionally, pay attention to the energy and dynamics of the music. Salsa and bachata music can range from slow and romantic to fast-paced and energetic, and being able to adapt to these changes can add flavor and expression to your dancing. Try to let the music guide your movements, and don't be afraid to add in your own flair and personality.

It's also great that you're taking salsa classes! Working with a instructor can help you improve your technique, build confidence, and learn new moves and patterns. Don't be afraid to ask questions or ask for feedback, and remember to always practice safely and listen to your body.

Lastly, don't forget to have fun and enjoy the process of learning and improving! Salsa and bachata are not just about the steps, but about the music, culture, and community. Keep dancing, and remember to ¡disfruta la música y el baile!
